Title:
Species delimitation and phylogenetic relationships in
Lactarius sect. Deliciosi in Europe
Abstract:
The phylogeny of Lactarius sect. Deliciosi was
investigated employing both molecular and morphological characters. We
used the nrDNA ITS sequences and an 800 bp fragment of the gene encoding
glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (gpd). Results confirm that
Lactarius sect. Deliciosi forms a monophyletic group within subgenus
Piperites. The section contains nine accepted species in Europe, eight
of which are traditionally being placed in sect. Deliciosi. Lactarius
porninsis, a species with white latex that is usually classified in
sect. Zonarii, also falls within in sect. Deliciosi. Some recently
described species are not confirmed here (L. sanguineovirescens) or
their status remains doubtful because of a lack of collections (L.
cyanopus). AFLP results show a clear distinction between the closely
related L. deterrimus and L. fennoscandicus.
